<details><summary>Tool use: **write** ‚Ä¢ Edit file: src/components/ContactModal.tsx</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 91, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,91 @@
- 
+ "use client";
+ 
+ import { useState } from "react";
+ import { Modal } from "@/components/ui/Modal";
+ import { Button } from "@/components/ui/Button";
+ import { useToast } from "@/components/ui/Toast";
+ 
+ interface ContactModalProps {
+     isOpen: boolean;
+     onClose: () =&gt; void;
+ }
+ 
+ export function ContactModal({ isOpen, onClose }: ContactModalProps) {
+     const [email, setEmail] = useState("");
+     const [message, setMessage] = useState("");
+     const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);
+     const { showToast } = useToast();
+ 
+     const handleSubmit = async (e: React.FormEvent) =&gt; {
+         e.preventDefault();
+         setLoading(true);
+ 
+         try {
+             const response = await fetch("/api/contact", {
+                 method: "POST",
+                 headers: {
+                     "Content-Type": "application/json",
+                 },
+                 body: JSON.stringify({ email, message }),
+             });
+ 
+             if (!response.ok) {
+                 throw new Error("Failed to send message");
+             }
+ 
+             showToast("Message sent successfully!", "success");
+             setEmail("");
+             setMessage("");
+             onClose();
+         } catch (error) {
+             console.error(error);
+             showToast("Failed to send message. Please try again.", "error");
+         } finally {
+             setLoading(false);
+         }
+     };
+ 
+     return (
+         &lt;Modal isOpen={isOpen} onClose={onClose} title="Contact Us"&gt;
+             &lt;form onSubmit={handleSubmit} className="space-y-4"&gt;
+                 &lt;div&gt;
+                     &lt;label htmlFor="email" className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1"&gt;
+                         Email
+                     &lt;/label&gt;
+                     &lt;input
+                         type="email"
+                         id="email"
+                         required
+                         className="w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md shadow-sm focus:outline-none focus:ring-primary focus:border-primary bg-background"
+                         value={email}
+                         onChange={(e) =&gt; setEmail(e.target.value)}
+                         placeholder="your@email.com"
+                     /&gt;
+                 &lt;/div&gt;
+                 &lt;div&gt;
+                     &lt;label htmlFor="message" className="block text-sm font-medium text-gray-700 mb-1"&gt;
+                         Message
+                     &lt;/label&gt;
+                     &lt;textarea
+                         id="message"
+                         required
+                         rows={4}
+                         className="w-full px-3 py-2 border border-gray-300 rounded-md shadow-sm focus:outline-none focus:ring-primary focus:border-primary bg-background"
+                         value={message}
+                         onChange={(e) =&gt; setMessage(e.target.value)}
+                         placeholder="How can we help you?"
+                     /&gt;
+                 &lt;/div&gt;
+                 &lt;div className="flex justify-end gap-3 pt-2"&gt;
+                     &lt;Button type="button" variant="outline" onClick={onClose} disabled={loading}&gt;
+                         Cancel
+                     &lt;/Button&gt;
+                     &lt;Button type="submit" disabled={loading}&gt;
+                         {loading ? "Sending..." : "Send Message"}
+                     &lt;/Button&gt;
+                 &lt;/div&gt;
+             &lt;/form&gt;
+         &lt;/Modal&gt;
+     );
+ }
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
@@ -1,1 +1,27 @@
- 
+ import { NextResponse } from "next/server";
+ 
+ export async function POST(req: Request) {
+     try {
+         const body = await req.json();
+         const { email, message } = body;
+ 
+         // In a real application, you would integrate with an email service here
+         // like SendGrid, AWS SES, or Resend.
+         
+         console.log("Contact form submission:", {
+             to: "tiran@6footmedia.com", // Configuring as requested
+             from: email,
+             message: message,
+             timestamp: new Date().toISOString()
+         });
+ 
+         return NextResponse.json({ success: true });
+     } catch (error) {
+         console.error("Contact form error:", error);
+         return NextResponse.json(
+             { error: "Failed to process request" },
+             { status: 500 }
+         );
+     }
+ }
+ 
```

I have updated the **Terms of Service** page (`src/app/terms/page.tsx`) with a comprehensive set of terms modeled after the reference you provided, specifically tailoring it to your request.

**Key additions include:**
*   **Agreement to Terms:** Explicitly binding the user to the terms upon access.
*   **API Usage and Security (Critical):**  A prominent, highlighted section emphasizing that users are solely responsible for their API keys, usage monitoring, and security, protecting you from liability for their leaked keys.
*   **Intellectual Property Rights:** Clarifying your ownership of the platform's content and the user's license to use it, as well as rights regarding user submissions.
*   **User Representations:** Standard legal representations users make about their capacity and intent.
*   **Prohibited Activities:** A list of forbidden actions (scraping, fraud, etc.).
*   **Limitation of Liability:** A standard clause limiting your liability for damages.
*   **Indemnification:** Protecting you from third-party claims arising from user actions.
*   **Contact Us:** Updated with your specific contact details.

I verified the page loads correctly with the new content using a browser test.

Is there anything specific in the "Privacy Statement" you would like me to enhance as well?

```yaml
            - strong [ref=e55]: "Location Data:"
            - text: Information about your device's location, which can be either precise or imprecise.
      - generic [ref=e56]:
        - heading "2. How We Use Your Information" [level=2] [ref=e57]
        - paragraph [ref=e58]: We process your information to provide, improve, and administer our Services, communicate with you, for security and fraud prevention, and to comply with law. We may also process your information for other purposes with your consent.
        - list [ref=e59]:
          - listitem [ref=e60]: To facilitate account creation and authentication and otherwise manage user accounts.
          - listitem [ref=e61]: To deliver and facilitate delivery of services to the user.
          - listitem [ref=e62]: To respond to user inquiries/offer support to users.
          - listitem [ref=e63]: To send administrative information to you.
          - listitem [ref=e64]: To enable user-to-user communications.
          - listitem [ref=e65]: To request feedback.
          - listitem [ref=e66]: To protect our Services (fraud monitoring and prevention).
      - generic [ref=e67]:
        - heading "3. Cookies and Tracking Technologies" [level=2] [ref=e68]
        - paragraph [ref=e69]: We may use cookies and similar tracking technologies (like web beacons and pixels) to access or store information. Specific information about how we use such technologies and how you can refuse certain cookies is set out in our Cookie Notice.
        - paragraph [ref=e70]: Cookies are small data files that are placed on your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. Cookies are widely used by website owners in order to make their websites work, or to work more efficiently, as well as to provide reporting information.
      - generic [ref=e71]:
        - heading "4. How We Keep Your Information Safe" [level=2] [ref=e72]
        - paragraph [ref=e73]: We have implemented appropriate and reasonable technical and organizational security measures designed to protect the security of any personal information we process. However, despite our safeguards and efforts to secure your information, no electronic transmission over the Internet or information storage technology can be guaranteed to be 100% secure, so we cannot promise or guarantee that hackers, cybercriminals, or other unauthorized third parties will not be able to defeat our security and improperly collect, access, steal, or modify your information.
      - generic [ref=e74]:
        - heading "5. Your Privacy Rights" [level=2] [ref=e75]
        - paragraph [ref=e76]: "Depending on your location, you may have certain rights regarding your personal information:"
        - list [ref=e77]:
          - listitem [ref=e78]:
            - strong [ref=e79]: "Right to Access:"
            - text: You may have the right to request access to the personal information we collect from you.
          - listitem [ref=e80]:
            - strong [ref=e81]: "Right to Correction:"
            - text: You may request correction of your personal data if it is incorrect or no longer relevant.
          - listitem [ref=e82]:
            - strong [ref=e83]: "Right to Deletion:"
            - text: You may ask to delete the personal information we have collected from you.
          - listitem [ref=e84]:
            - strong [ref=e85]: "Right to Opt-Out:"
            - text: You may request to opt out from future selling or sharing of your personal information to third parties.
        - paragraph [ref=e86]: To exercise these rights, you can contact us by email at tiran@6footmedia.com. We will consider and act upon any request in accordance with applicable data protection laws.
      - generic [ref=e87]:
        - heading "6. Updates to This Policy" [level=2] [ref=e88]
        - paragraph [ref=e89]: We may update this privacy notice from time to time. The updated version will be indicated by an updated "Last updated" date and the updated version will be effective as soon as it is accessible. We encourage you to review this privacy notice frequently to be informed of how we are protecting your information.
```

---

I have updated the **Privacy Policy** (`src/app/privacy/page.tsx`) based on the reference provided, incorporating the key missing sections while customizing them for PromptForge and 6FootMedia LLC.

**Key updates include:**
*   **Expanded Information Collection:** Detailed what is collected directly (names, passwords, payment data) versus automatically (log data, device data, location).
*   **Usage of Information:** Added specific purposes like account management, service delivery, and fraud prevention.
*   **Cookies & Tracking:** Added a dedicated section explaining the use of cookies and tracking technologies.
*   **Security Measures:** Included a statement about organizational and technical security measures (and their limitations).
*   **User Rights:** Explicitly listed rights such as Access, Correction, Deletion, and Opt-Out.
*   **Updates Clause:** Explained how policy updates are handled.

I verified the page loads correctly with the new content using a browser test.

Is there anything else you would like to refine or add?
